newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - PHH shrs leap after bid.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - PHH shrs leap after bid.

text.p: Shares in PHH Corp soared to 47 from 30-3/4 preceding Monday's U.S. market open on news it agreed to be taken over by HFS Inc in a $1.7 billion stock-swap deal.
Terms of the pact value PHH at $49.50 per share.
HFS shares, which finished Friday trade at 74-1/8, made no move preceding the market open.

HFS said would issue about 23.2 million common shares in exchange for all outstanding PHH shares in the deal. The maximum number of shares would be 28.7 million and the minimum would be 21.3 million, based on an average HFS share prices of $60 and $81 before the PHH shareholders' vote, HFS said.
In another deal, IVAX Corp shares fell after it announced this morning an agreement to merge with Bergen Brunswig Corp.
IVAX traded at 13-5/8, down from 15-3/4, ahead of the opening bell because terms of the deal value IVAX at about $13.75 per share.
Bergen Brunswig made no moved before the open, traders said.

In other pre-open trade, Intel Corp slipped 1/4 to 122, Novell Inc slipped 1/8 to 11-3/8, Cygnus Inc fell 1-3/4 to 13 and Doubletree rose to 41-1/4 from 40-3/8 after Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to a strong buy from outperform.
